nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Negative Prompt)

widgets_values: you don't need an overly detailed prompt, but it's better than leaving it blank

OPTIONAL - style/character lora
Disabled by default.
It's very important that your reference image is aligned as perfectly as possible with the first frame of your input video, otherwise you might get artifacts and weird motion.
If you want to generate in text-to-video mode, simply bypass the conditioning reference image

Recommended dimensions:
768x512 - good starting point for 1st pass before upscale

906x512 - for a closer 16:9 aspect ratio

1216x704 - For High VRAM machines, you might not need to do the 2nd upscale pass,

number of frames should be a multiple of 8 plus one, eg. 9, 17, 25, etc.

for 'depth' switch to '1'
for 'pose'  switch to '2'
for 'canny' switch to '3'

For human subjects I recommend Pose.
For objects/general stuff try Depth
For precise edge detection try Canny.
